uniqueRequirements: The test is cumulative: You must answer 30 out of 40 questions correctly (75%) to pass
Drivers under 18 holding a probationary license for less than 12 months cannot drive between midnight and 6 AM
Temporary Instruction Permit Identification Card (TIPIC) holders under 18 must practice for 50 hours (10 at night) before the road test
During the first 12 months of a probationary license, you may not drive with more than one non-family member passenger

questions.questionText: In Ohio, it is illegal to operate a vehicle with a BAC of ___ or higher if you are 21 or older.
questions.explanation: The legal limit for BAC in Ohio is 0.08% for drivers 21 and over.

questions.questionText: For drivers under 21, the legal BAC limit is:
questions.explanation: Ohio has a 'zero tolerance' law. Drivers under 21 are considered impaired with a BAC of 0.02% or higher.

questions.questionText: Ohio's Move Over Law requires drivers approaching a stationary public safety vehicle with lights flashing to:

answers.text: Change lanes into a lane not adjacent to the vehicle, or slow down if changing lanes is impossible

questions.explanation: You must move over to a non-adjacent lane. If you cannot, you must slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: Using a handheld electronic wireless communications device while driving is a ___ offense for adults in Ohio.
questions.explanation: Distracted driving (using a phone) is a primary offense in Ohio.

questions.questionText: If a school bus is stopped on a road with fewer than four lanes and its red lights are flashing:

answers.text: Only traffic behind the bus must stop
Traffic in both directions must stop

questions.explanation: On a road with fewer than four lanes, all traffic approaching the bus from either direction must stop at least 10 feet from the bus.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: In Ohio, parking within 10 feet of a fire hydrant is prohibited.

questions.questionText: Probationary license holders under 18 may not drive between:
questions.explanation: For the first 12 months, license holders under 18 may not drive between midnight and 6 AM.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a municipal corporation (town/city) is:
questions.explanation: The statutory speed limit in most Ohio residential/business districts is 25 mph.

questions.questionText: Use of studded tires is permitted only between:
questions.explanation: Studded tires are legal in Ohio from November 1 through April 15.

questions.questionText: You must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights on a four-lane road:

answers.text: Only if you are traveling in the same direction as the bus

questions.explanation: On a road with four or more lanes, only traffic proceeding in the same direction as the bus must stop.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in alleys is:
questions.explanation: The statutory speed limit for alleys in Ohio is 15 mph.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to turn left on red unless:

answers.text: Turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street

questions.explanation: Left on red is only legal when turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street.

questions.questionText: You must use headlights:

answers.text: From sunset to sunrise and during rain/snow/fog

questions.explanation: Headlights are required from sunset to sunrise and whenever wipers are used.

questions.questionText: Vehicles moving slower than the flow of traffic must:
questions.explanation: Slower traffic must keep to the right lane.

questions.questionText: When you move, you must notify the BMV of your new address within:
questions.explanation: Ohio law requires reporting an address change within 10 days.

questions.questionText: Front seat passengers must wear a seat belt:

answers.text: Only if the driver is under 18

questions.explanation: Ohio requires the driver and front-seat passengers to wear seat belts.

questions.questionText: Children under the age of ___ or weighing less than 40 pounds must be in a child safety seat.
questions.explanation: Children under 4 years old or under 40 pounds must be in a safety seat.

questions.questionText: A child aged 4 to 8 who is less than 4 feet 9 inches tall must use:
questions.explanation: Children 4-8 years old and under 4'9" require a booster seat.

questions.questionText: The speed limit on state routes within municipal corporations outside business districts is:
questions.explanation: The standard limit on state routes inside municipalities (not business districts) is 35 mph.

questions.questionText: In Ohio, it is illegal to park within ___ feet of a stop sign.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 30 feet of a stop sign, flashing beacon, or traffic signal.

questions.questionText: When driving in fog, you must use:
questions.explanation: High beams reflect off fog; low beams are required.

questions.questionText: Littering from a motor vehicle is:

answers.text: Illegal and punishable by a fine and jail

questions.explanation: Littering is a serious offense in Ohio carrying fines and potential jail time.

questions.questionText: A turn signal must be given at least ___ feet before the turn.
questions.explanation: You must signal at least 100 feet before making a turn.

questions.questionText: If you are approached by an emergency vehicle displaying flashing lights and an audible signal, you must:

answers.text: Drive to the right curb and stop

questions.explanation: Yield the right of way, drive to the right edge of the road, and stop.

questions.questionText: Tinted glass on the front side windows must allow ___ light transmittance.
questions.explanation: Ohio law requires 50% light transmittance for front side windows.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to drive with parking lights illuminated:

answers.text: While the vehicle is in motion

questions.explanation: Driving with only parking lights on is illegal in Ohio.

questions.questionText: Unless posted otherwise, the speed limit on rural interstates in Ohio is:
questions.explanation: Rural interstates often have a speed limit of 70 mph.

questions.questionText: When a car is stopped at a crosswalk to allow a pedestrian to cross, you must:
questions.explanation: It is illegal to pass a vehicle stopped for a pedestrian.

questions.questionText: Vehicles parked on a roadway must be within ___ of the curb.
questions.explanation: In Ohio, parked vehicles must be within 12 inches of the curb.

questions.questionText: If you damage a parked vehicle, you must:

answers.text: Leave a note with your info and notify police

questions.explanation: You must leave your information and notify the police.

questions.questionText: A broken yellow line on your side of the roadway means:
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line indicates passing is allowed if safe.

questions.questionText: A pennant-shaped sign on the left side of the road means:
questions.explanation: The pennant shape is exclusively used for No Passing Zones.

questions.questionText: A five-sided sign shaped like an old schoolhouse means:
questions.explanation: The pentagon shape indicates a school zone or crossing.

questions.questionText: A red circle with a slash through it means:
questions.explanation: This symbol means 'NO' - the action pictured is prohibited.

questions.questionText: A yellow diamond sign with a truck going down a hill means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a steep downgrade.

questions.questionText: A round yellow sign with X and RR indicates:
questions.explanation: The advance warning sign for a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: Orange signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Orange signs warn of construction zones.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a cross (+) means:
questions.explanation: A cross symbol warns of a crossroad/intersection.

questions.questionText: A vertical rectangle sign indicates:
questions.explanation: Vertical rectangles are regulatory signs (e.g., Speed Limit).

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a deer means:
questions.explanation: Deer crossing warning.

questions.questionText: An octagon shaped sign is a:
questions.explanation: The octagon is exclusively for Stop signs.

questions.questionText: An inverted triangle (pointing down) sign is a:
questions.explanation: The inverted triangle is exclusively for Yield signs.

questions.questionText: Blue signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Blue signs provide motorist service information.

questions.questionText: Brown signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Brown signs point to parks, museums, and recreation.

questions.questionText: A diamond shaped sign is a:
questions.explanation: Diamond shapes are used for warnings.

questions.questionText: A sign with two arrows pointing in opposite directions means:
questions.explanation: Warns of two-way traffic ahead.

questions.questionText: A sign showing a car with squiggly lines behind the tires means:
questions.explanation: Warns that the road is slippery when wet.

questions.questionText: A sign with a right angle arrow means:
questions.explanation: Indicates a sharp turn to the right.

questions.questionText: A sign with a curved arrow means:
questions.explanation: Warns of a curve in the road.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Merge' arrow means:
questions.explanation: Warns that traffic is merging into your lane.

questions.questionText: A sign with a flagger symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warns of a flagger controlling traffic in a work zone.

questions.questionText: A red and white sign saying 'Wrong Way' means:
questions.explanation: Do not enter; you are going against traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Do Not Enter' means:

answers.text: You may not enter this road

questions.explanation: Prohibits entry into a roadway.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No U-Turn' means:
questions.explanation: Prohibits making a U-turn.

questions.questionText: A sign with a bicycle symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warns of bicycle traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with a pedestrian symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warns of pedestrian activity.

questions.questionText: A sign with a tractor symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warns of farm machinery on or crossing the road.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Lane Ends Merge Left' means:
questions.explanation: The right lane is ending; merge left.

questions.questionText: A sign with a signal light symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warns of a traffic signal ahead.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Keep Right' and an arrow around a divider means:

answers.text: Keep to the right of the obstruction

questions.explanation: Keep to the right of the median/divider.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Low Clearance 12ft 6in' means:
questions.explanation: Warns of low overhead clearance.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Turn on Red' means:

answers.text: You must wait for green to turn

questions.explanation: Prohibits turning right on a red light.

questions.questionText: A shield-shaped sign usually indicates:
questions.explanation: Shields identify route numbers (Interstate, US, State).

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Dip' means:
questions.explanation: Warns of a depression in the road surface.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Soft Shoulder' means:
questions.explanation: Do not drive on the shoulder as it may be soft.

questions.questionText: In fog, rain, or snow, you should use:
questions.explanation: Use low beams. High beams will reflect off precipitation and blind you.

questions.questionText: If your vehicle goes into a skid:

answers.text: Steer in the direction of the skid

questions.explanation: Take your foot off the gas and turn the steering wheel in the direction the rear of the vehicle is skidding.

questions.questionText: When you are being passed, you should:

answers.text: Maintain speed and stay to the right

questions.explanation: Maintain a constant speed and keep to the right to allow the other vehicle to pass safely.

questions.questionText: If a tire blows out:

answers.text: Keep the wheel straight and slow down gradually

questions.explanation: Do not panic brake. Keep vehicle straight and let it slow down.

questions.questionText: When merging onto a freeway:

answers.text: Accelerate to the speed of traffic

questions.explanation: Use the ramp to accelerate to highway speed to merge safely.

questions.questionText: To prevent fatigue on long trips:
questions.explanation: Rest frequently to stay alert.

questions.questionText: To recover from a skid, you should:

answers.text: Steer into the skid (direction rear is going)

questions.explanation: Steer in the direction the rear is sliding.

questions.questionText: The 'three-second rule' applies to:
questions.explanation: Ohio recommends maintaining a three-second following distance.

questions.questionText: When roads are wet, you should:
questions.explanation: Reduce speed to prevent hydroplaning.

questions.questionText: If you run off the pavement:

answers.text: Slow down and steer back gradually

questions.explanation: Do not jerk the wheel. Slow down first, then steer back.

questions.questionText: Hydroplaning can occur at speeds as low as:
questions.explanation: Tires can lose contact with the road at speeds as low as 35 mph in rain.

questions.questionText: If your brakes fail:
questions.explanation: Pump the brakes to build pressure. If that fails, use the parking brake.

questions.questionText: Night driving is dangerous because:
questions.explanation: Vision is reduced and distance judgment is impaired.

questions.questionText: When passing a bicyclist, you should:
questions.explanation: Ohio requires leaving at least 3 feet of clearance when passing a bicycle.

questions.questionText: Blind spots are:

answers.text: Areas you can't see in mirrors

questions.explanation: Areas to the side/rear not visible in mirrors.

questions.questionText: Large trucks have:
questions.explanation: Trucks have large 'No-Zones' where cars disappear.

questions.questionText: When following a motorcycle, you should:
questions.explanation: Motorcycles can stop quickly; allow extra space.

questions.questionText: If an oncoming vehicle has high beams on:

answers.text: Look to the right edge of the road

questions.explanation: Look to the right to avoid glare.

questions.questionText: In work zones, you should:
questions.explanation: Traffic fines are doubled in work zones; drive carefully.

questions.questionText: Carbon monoxide is:
questions.explanation: Exhaust leaks can cause deadly carbon monoxide poisoning.

questions.questionText: If your accelerator sticks:
questions.explanation: Shift to neutral to disengage engine power.

questions.questionText: Alcohol affects:
questions.explanation: Alcohol impairs all driving skills.

questions.questionText: The only thing that sobers you up is:
questions.explanation: Only time allows the body to process alcohol.

questions.questionText: When entering a curve, you should:
questions.explanation: Slow down before the curve to maintain control.

questions.questionText: Distracted driving includes:
questions.explanation: Anything taking attention from the road is a distraction.

questions.questionText: If you are tired:
questions.explanation: Rest is the only cure for fatigue.

questions.questionText: During a tire blowout, steer:
questions.explanation: Keep the car going straight until it slows down.

questions.questionText: Use your horn:
questions.explanation: The horn is a warning device.

questions.questionText: Check your mirrors:
questions.explanation: Check mirrors frequently to know traffic conditions.

questions.questionText: Before backing up:

answers.text: Check mirrors and look over shoulder

questions.explanation: Check all blind spots before backing.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: 10 feet is the minimum distance.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a stop sign.
questions.explanation: 30 feet is the minimum distance from a stop sign or traffic signal.

questions.questionText: When parking downhill with a curb, turn wheels:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels to curb so car rolls into it if brakes fail.

questions.questionText: When parking uphill with a curb, turn wheels:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels away from curb so tire catches curb if car rolls back.

questions.questionText: Vehicles parked on a roadway must be within ___ of the curb.
questions.explanation: Must be within 12 inches.

questions.questionText: Parking is prohibited:
questions.explanation: All listed locations are illegal for parking.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: Do not park within 50 feet of a railroad track.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.
questions.explanation: Do not park within 20 feet of a crosswalk.

questions.questionText: When parking on a hill without a curb, turn wheels:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels to the right so car rolls off road, not into traffic.

questions.questionText: Handicapped parking spaces are marked by:
questions.explanation: Blue indicates disabled parking.

questions.questionText: When two vehicles arrive at a 4-way stop at the same time:

answers.text: Vehicle on left yields to right
Vehicle on right yields to left

questions.explanation: Left yields to right.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a yield sign. You must:

answers.text: Slow down and yield to traffic

questions.explanation: Yield means give way to cross traffic.

questions.questionText: Pedestrians have the right of way:
questions.explanation: Yield to pedestrians in crosswalks.

questions.questionText: When turning left, you must yield to:
questions.explanation: Left turners yield to oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: At an uncontrolled intersection (no signs/lights):
questions.explanation: Treat as a 4-way stop/yield to right.

questions.questionText: When entering a road from a driveway:
questions.explanation: Traffic on the road has right of way.

questions.questionText: Emergency vehicles with lights flashing have right of way. You must:

answers.text: Drive to right edge and stop

questions.explanation: Clear the way for emergency vehicles.

questions.questionText: A funeral procession has the right of way:
questions.explanation: Do not cut through a funeral procession.

questions.questionText: When making a right turn on red:
questions.explanation: Stop fully, then turn if clear.

questions.questionText: In a traffic circle/roundabout:
questions.explanation: Yield to circulating traffic.

questions.questionText: Blind pedestrians with a white cane:
questions.explanation: Always yield to blind pedestrians.

questions.questionText: If you arrive at a stop sign before another car:
questions.explanation: First to stop, first to go.

questions.questionText: When a traffic light turns green:
questions.explanation: Wait for intersection to clear.

questions.questionText: On a T-intersection, traffic on the terminating road must:

answers.text: Yield to traffic on through road

questions.explanation: Ending road yields to through road.

questions.questionText: When passing a vehicle traveling in the same direction, you must yield to:
questions.explanation: Ensure no oncoming traffic before passing.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a 6-point violation in Ohio?
questions.explanation: Fleeing/eluding, Hit-skip, OVI are 6 points.

questions.questionText: Speeding 30 mph or more over the limit results in ___ points.
questions.explanation: 30+ mph over is a 4-point violation.

questions.questionText: Operating a Vehicle Impaired (OVI) results in ___ points.
questions.explanation: OVI is a 6-point offense.

questions.questionText: A driver accumulates 12 points in 2 years. They face:
questions.explanation: 12 points in 2 years leads to suspension.

questions.questionText: Texting while driving (adults) is a ___ offense.
questions.explanation: Texting is a primary offense.

questions.questionText: Failure to stop for a school bus is a fine of up to:
questions.explanation: Fines can be up to $500.

questions.questionText: Refusal to take a chemical test (Implied Consent) results in:
questions.explanation: Automatic Administrative License Suspension (ALS).

questions.questionText: Not wearing a seat belt is a ___ offense.
questions.explanation: Seat belt violation is a secondary offense (except for children).

questions.questionText: Speeding 1-5 mph over the limit usually results in ___ points.
questions.explanation: Usually 0 points for <5 mph over (unless specific zones).

questions.questionText: Speeding 6-29 mph over the limit results in ___ points.
questions.explanation: 2 points for moderate speeding.

questions.questionText: Failure to stop at a stop sign is ___ points.
questions.explanation: Stop sign violation is 2 points.

questions.questionText: Following too closely (tailgating) is ___ points.
questions.explanation: Tailgating is 2 points.

questions.questionText: The reinstatement fee for a suspended license (12 points) is:
questions.explanation: Reinstatement fee is $40.

questions.questionText: Driving under suspension is a ___ offense.
questions.explanation: First degree misdemeanor.

questions.questionText: Street racing is a ___ point violation.
questions.explanation: Street racing is 6 points.

questions.questionText: A flashing yellow light means:
questions.explanation: Caution.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'One Way' and an arrow:

answers.text: Traffic flows only in direction of arrow

questions.explanation: Traffic flows only in direction of arrow.

questions.questionText: When backing up, you should:
questions.explanation: Look over shoulder to check blind spots.

questions.questionText: Can you turn left on red from a two-way to a one-way street?
questions.explanation: No. Only one-way to one-way.

questions.questionText: Who has the right of way at a T-intersection?
questions.explanation: Through road has right of way.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'Soft Shoulder' means:
questions.explanation: Shoulder is soft/unpaved.

questions.questionText: If you are tired:
questions.explanation: Rest is the only cure.

questions.questionText: Passing on the right is permitted when:

answers.text: Vehicle ahead turning left & room to pass

questions.explanation: Legal if vehicle turning left and pavement is wide enough.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Outlet' means:
questions.explanation: Road does not connect.

questions.questionText: Most rear-end collisions are caused by:
questions.explanation: Tailgating causes rear-end crashes.

questions.questionText: Headlights must be used when visibility is less than:
questions.explanation: Usually 1000 feet or when wipers are on (Ohio law says sunset/sunrise & precipitation; generally 1000ft is the visibility standard).

questions.questionText: You are entering a roadway from an alley:
questions.explanation: Yield to roadway traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Dip' means:
questions.explanation: Depression in road.

questions.questionText: If an animal runs in front of you:
questions.explanation: Don't swerve dangerously.

questions.questionText: Bicycles on the road:
questions.explanation: Bicycles are vehicles.
